section.section: There is a Montgomery County Historic Preservation Grant Fund.
There is a Prince George's County Historic Property Grant Fund.

text.section: Each county planning board administers its Fund.

Each county planning board shall deposit in its Fund those amounts authorized in accordance with Title 18, Subtitle 1 of this article to:
implement and encourage restoration and preservation of historic properties; and
implement the purposes of its Program.

section.section: Each county planning board shall expend the amounts in its Fund to make grants to nonprofit organizations or foundations.

In Montgomery County:
grants may also be made for research, developing educational materials, and generally promoting historic preservation; and
in making grants, the county planning board, if practical to do so, shall obtain and implement the recommendations of the Montgomery County Historic Preservation Commission.

In Prince George's County:
grants may also be made to political subdivisions or individuals to acquire, preserve, restore, or rehabilitate historic properties; and
in making grants, the county planning board shall solicit and consider the recommendations of the Prince George's County Historic Preservation Commission.

text.section: When a county planning board awards a grant, the grant recipient shall convey a perpetual preservation easement to the county planning board.

section.section: Decisions by a county planning board concerning grants shall be made without regard to the financial status or annual income of the applicant.
Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, a county planning board may require matching funds in whatever proportion the county planning board considers appropriate.
